name: src/Engine.js
_Engine
description:
Engine Singleton class. Entry point reference to access managers and
to start and stop the Engine.

name: constructor
description: Engine Contstructor.

name: start
description: Starts the engine.

name: end
description: Stops the engine and cleans up code.

name: pause
description: Pauses the entire engine.

name: unpause
description: Resumes to the Engine.

name: src/base/Updateable.js
Updateable
description:
Baseclass for objects that follow the same ECS pattern of the seed engine.

Used in anything that should follow a create, update, end loop 
handled by the Engine.

Many things will need to update/start/end. If you derive something that
has the start()/update()/end()... functions, the children should fill in
their respective callbacks (onStart()/onUpdate()/onEnd()/...).

name: start
description: Base call function for when this Updateable is to be started.

name: update
description:
Base call function for when this Updateable is to be updated.

Is overwritten on successful start to a simpler update loop.

name: end
description: Base call function for when this Updateable is to be ended.

name: pause
description: Base call function for when this Updateable is to be paused.

name: unpause
description: Base call function for when this Updateable is to be unpaused.

name: destructor
description: Cleanup code for when destroying an Updateable.

name: onStart
description:
Called when the the object is first introduced.

Managing code will call this on first iteration once introduced to the game loop.

name: onUpdate
description: Called on every update within the game, once the object has had onStart called.

name: onEnd
description: Called when the object is being removed or cleaned up from usage.

name: onPause
description: Called when the object is intended to be paused.

name: onUnpause
description: Called when the object is to be unpaused from paused state.

name: src/component/Audio.js
Audio
description:
A Component that can be attatched to any GameObject.

The Audio Component has controls for playing sounds and music.
Audio can be locallized to the Object location it is attached to.

name: src/component/BoxCollider.js
BoxCollider
description:
A 2D Collider Component which can be attached to any GameObject.

A BoxCollider Component monitors collisions with other Collider Components. 

This component is refined to a 2D square.

name: src/component/CircleCollider.js
CircleCollider
description:
A 2D Collider Component which can be attached to any GameObject.

A CircleCollider Component monitors collisions with other Collider Components. 

This component is refined to a 2D circle. A point of origin and radius.

name: src/component/ClickController.js
src/component/Collider.js
Collider
description:
A Collider Component that checks bounds for collisions.

This commponent has interface functions for calculating collisions
which have to be defined to work. See Subclasses.

name: src/component/Collider2D.js
Collider2D
description:
A Collider Component that checks bounds only on a plane.

This commponent has interface functions for calculating collisions
which have to be defined to work. See Subclasses.

name: src/component/Component.js
Component
description:
A component may be added to any GameObject by using
GameObject's function: addComponent(component).

A component should redefine the Updateable functions inherited with custom code to define the Component functionality.

name: constructor
description:
Constructor for Base Components.
Requires a boolean to indicate if a GameObject can contain multiple
components of this type.

params.name: unique
params.description: Is there only one of these component allowed on a GameObject?

name: onAddComponent
description: Called when the component is successfully added to a GameObject.

name: src/component/Controller.js
Controller
description:
A Baseclass for controller components. It is advised to use
controllers to contain movement logic. There are basic movement and 
onClick controllers. You may make your own, remember to derive this class.

name: src/component/Physics.js
content:
import Component from './Component';

/**
 * A Physics Component can be added to any GameObject and will give it
 * physical properties which can be toggled and adjusted.
 * 
 * This Component should have nothing to do with collisions. Instead, Physics
 * should provide pre and post reactions to collisions, gravity, frictions,
 * and anything else that should respond to an effect or change.
 * 
 * This is intended to be a base class for more specific physics handling
 * depending on the application.
 */
export default class Physics extends Component {
    
}

name: Physics
description:
A Physics Component can be added to any GameObject and will give it
physical properties which can be toggled and adjusted.

This Component should have nothing to do with collisions. Instead, Physics
should provide pre and post reactions to collisions, gravity, frictions,
and anything else that should respond to an effect or change.

This is intended to be a base class for more specific physics handling
depending on the application.

name: src/component/Physics2D.js
src/component/Renderable.js
Renderable
description:
Base Renderable Component for all Components that want to draw to the screen. If
you want to show something on screen, it should derive Renderable.

Contained in the class are functions for attaching the Renderable to viewports,
and updating Transform data into matricies for use with the Render Manager.

The Renderable Component contains data on how the Renderable expects to be rendered.
Programs, render vectors, shader data, and other data that is on a per-object basis
for rendering is defined here.

Classes which derive a Renderable should handle all base data and add or modify data
as needed to achieve certain effects.

name: constructor
description:
Constructor for the Renderable component. Allows defaults to be assigned without
having to call setter functions later.

params.name: program
params.description: A Program Object from the ProgramManager.

name: getMatrix
description: Returns a joined matrix of position, scale, rotation and origin adjustment.

name: setPosition
description: Sets the position matrix to the new position point assigned.

params.name: point
params.description: A position point.

name: setOriginOffset
description:
Sets the origin offset matrix to the new position point assigned. This matrix reacts differently from other matrix
assignment. 0,0 is regular top left corner origin, -0.5, -0.5 centers the origin to the center of the Transform, and
-1, -1 will align the origin to the bottom right.

params.name: point
params.description: Origin offset point.

name: setRotation
description:
Sets the rotation matrix to the new rotation value assigned.

TODO: Change to a rotation point for x, y, z rotation instead of just z.

params.name: rotation
params.description: A rotation in degrees.

name: setScale
description: Sets the scale matrix to the new scale point assigned.

params.name: scale
params.description: A scale point.

name: onAddComponent
description:
Called immediatly after the Render component is added to a game object.

Updates the data of this renderable to the current Transform data.

name: addToViewport
description: Adds this component to another viewport to be drawn.

params.name: viewportID
params.description: Object ID of the viewport.

name: removeFromViewports
description: Removes the renderable from all viewports.

name: src/component/Renderable2D.js
Renderable2D
description:
Renderable2D is a renderable component which focusses on
2D shaders and matricies for 2D space rendering.

name: src/component/RenderableSquare.js
src/component/TopDownController.js
TopDownController
description:
A Controller Component with extra methods designed for controlling a 
character in a Top-Down Perspective view.

name: isUpPressed
description: Returns true if this game update notices a key press for 'W' or Up key.

name: isDownPressed
description: Returns true if this game update notices a key press for 'S' or Down key.

name: isLeftPressed
description: Returns true if this game update notices a key press for 'A' or Left key.

name: isRightPressed
description: Returns true if this game update notices a key press for 'D' or Right key.

name: src/component/Transform.js
Transform
description:
A component all GameObjects are given by default on instantiation.

Transform components are unique to the object, meaning there cannot be more than
one Transform on a GameObject.

Transforms keep track of GameObject position, scale (size), rotation, and 
origin offset. These should be changes with their respective setters, and not directly,
to ensure the correct components are notified of these changes.

TODO: Make rotation work on 3 axis like position and scale.
TODO: Change the updates and setters of the position/scale/rotation to use funcions in their base
definitions and remove the wrappers here to reduce code.

name: setPosition
description: Sets the Transforms position.

params.name: x
params.description: X position. Defaults to current X position.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position. Defaults to current Y position.

params.name: z
params.description: Z position. Defaults to current Z position.

name: centerOrigin
description:
Triggers between two types of regularly used origin points. 

Origin points are used with Renderables and other components to offset the origin different from the Transform's position.

"Center": (-0.5, -0.5, -0.5) centered to the Tranform's position, and "Default": (0, 0, 0), beginning at the top left of the Transform.

params.name: center
params.description: "Center" if true, "Default" if false.

name: setOriginOffset
description:
Sets the origin offset position. 

If you want an object to exist at a 
position, but do something else (like drawing, animations) 
in a relative position the the Tranform, use this to change the 
offset from the Transfrom.

(0, 0, 0) would be top left of the transform. 
(-0.5, -0.5, -0.5) would be center of the transform. 
(-1, -1, -1) would be bottom right of transform.

Parameters default to their current values.

params.name: x
params.description: X axis offset. Defaults to current origin offset X.

params.name: y
params.description: Y axis offset. Defaults to current origin offset Y.

params.name: z
params.description: Z axis offset. Defaults to current origin offset Z.

name: setRotation
description:
Rotates the transform to face a different direction.

TODO: implement more than z axis rotation.

params.name: rotation
params.description: Rotation around the Z axis (in degrees).

params.name: scaleX
params.description: X scale from 1. Defaults to current scale X.

params.name: scaleY
params.description: Y scale from 1. Defaults to current scale Y.

params.name: scaleZ
params.description: Z scale from 1. Defaults to current scale Z.

name: translate
description: Adds the parameters of this function to the Transforms position.

params.name: x
params.description: X position. Defaults to 0.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position. Defaults to 0.

params.name: z
params.description: Z position. Defaults to 0.

name: rotate
description: Adds the rotation parameter to the current Transform rotation.

params.name: rotation
params.description: Rotation to add.

name: scale
description: Adds the parameters of this function to the Transforms scale.

params.name: scaleX
params.description: X scale. Defaults to 0.

params.name: scaleY
params.description: Y scale. Defaults to 0.

params.name: scaleZ
params.description: Z scale. Defaults to 0.

name: src/const/FragmentShader.js
DEFAULT_F
description: Default fragment shader which handles single colors.

name: src/const/VertexShader.js
DEFAULT_V
description: Default vertex shader that handles 2D matricies (3x3 matricies) to screen space.

name: src/entry.js
src/internal/Bounds.js
Bounds
description:
Two points which represent a bounding square.

TODO: Add z index for 3D.

params.name: x
params.description: The x position of the bounding box. (x1)

params.name: y
params.description: The y position of the bounding box. (y1)

params.name: w
params.description: The end x position, or width, of the bounding box. (x2)

params.name: h
params.description: The end x position, or height, of the bounding box. (y2)

name: set
description: Sets the bounding box to a new position.

params.name: x
params.description: The x position of the bounding box. (x1)

params.name: y
params.description: The y position of the bounding box. (y1)

params.name: w
params.description: The end x position, or width, of the bounding box. (x2)

params.name: h
params.description: The end x position, or height, of the bounding box. (y2)

name: isInBounds
description: Checks to see if the point [parameter 0] is within bounds.

params.name: point
params.description: Point to check within bounds.

name: src/internal/Color.js
Color
description:
A color with r, g, b, a values between 0 and 1.

Contains instatiation functions for creating default 
colors without explicitly defining the values.

name: constructor
description: Builds a color into an array for easy access for WebGL.

params.name: r
params.description: Red value between 0 - 1

params.name: g
params.description: Green value between 0 - 1

params.name: b
params.description: Blue value between 0 - 1

params.name: a
params.description: Alpha value between 0 - 1

params.name: r
params.description: Red value between 0 - 1. Defaults to previous value.

params.name: g
params.description: Green value between 0 - 1. Defaults to previous value.

params.name: b
params.description: Blue value between 0 - 1. Defaults to previous value.

params.name: a
params.description: Alpha value between 0 - 1. Defaults to previous value.

name: green
description: Returns a new color with the color green. Value: #00FF00 with alpha 1.

name: blue
description: Returns a new color with the color blue. Value: #0000FF with alpha 1.

name: red
description: Returns a new color with the color red. Value: #FF0000 with alpha 1.

name: pink
description: Returns a new color with the color pink. Value: #FF1493 with alpha 1.

name: src/internal/Point.js
Point
description: A point with x, y, z values. It may also be referred to as a Vector.

name: constructor
description: An x, y, z point. Default parameters are set as 0.

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the point.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the point.

params.name: z
params.description: Z position of the point.

name: set
description:
Sets the point to a new x, y, z. Previous values are set
as default parameters.

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the point.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the point.

params.name: z
params.description: Z position of the point.

name: src/internal/PostBoard.js
PostBoard
description:
Experemental! Still looking at other ways to implement this that would be more useful
for the engine, and lower lookup, post, and watch runtimes.

A "PostBoard" is a messaging system that anyone who has reference to may "post" updates to.
Posts are any type of data, assigned by key.
Other objects may look at "posts", and continuously watch a "post".

name: src/manager/AudioManager.js
src/manager/DOMManager.js
_DOMManager
description:
Manages the connection between the DOM and the Game & Engine.

The DOMManager sets up and holds reference to the DOM elements required to display the game.

name: constructor
description: Initializes defaults for the DOMManager to hold once started.

name: start
description: Loads the canvas & setup for WebGL.

name: loadCanvas
description:
Loads the canvas & sets up a WebGL2 context to be used by the engine by the id 'game'. If nothing is happening on screen,
ensure that the canvas you are using has this id in its HTML tag.

name: src/manager/EngineManager.js
_EngineManager
description:
A singleton & Manager.

This class manages the core ECS system & game loop. It calls all other Managers
required to start. 

TODO: This system will be rewritten to allow Manager plugins to be added by the 
user without editing the Engine.

name: start
description:
Called when the Engine should start all systems.
This also includes specific setup code to get the game running, 
including setting up the render loop.

name: update
description:
The EngineManager sets up a loop on start() to call this function.
Recalling this function will force a game update.

name: end
description: Ends the Engine by calling all manager end functions.

name: pause
description: Pauses the Engine by calling all manager pause functions.

name: unpause
description: Unpauses the Engine by calling all manager unpause functions.

name: src/manager/InputManager.js
src/manager/Manager.js
Manager
description:
Baseclass for all Managers.

In order for a new Manager to be added to the engine, it must inherit
this class and define these functions to be recognized by the Engine.

TODO: Finish Plugins in Engine Manager & implement optional function calls on updateables.

name: src/manager/NetworkManager.js
src/manager/PersistentManager.js
_PersistentManager
description:
Manages all Persistent Objects in the Engine. A PersistentObject is a child of 
GameObject, and sibling of SceneObjects.

PersistentObjects exist and update in all scenes, changing scenes will not inturrupt this object.

name: registerPersistentObject
description:
When a PersistentObject is created, it is assigned to the PersistentManager through this function.
The manager will keep reference to the Object and handle Engine events.

params.name: persistentObject
params.description: A PersistentObject.

name: update
description: Calls update on all Persistent Objects.

name: end
description: Calls end on all Persistent Objects.

name: pause
description: Calls pause on all Persistent Objects.

name: unpause
description: Calls unpause on all Persistent Objects.

name: src/manager/PhysicsManager.js
src/manager/ProgramManager.js
_ProgramManager
description:
Manages WebGL Programs so that they only need to be created once across the engine
allowing multiple objects to still share the same reference.

Elliminates the need for the programmer to compile shaders and create programs, and eases 
on-the-fly Shader compiling.

name: start
description: Creates default programs for easy reference later on.

name: getProgram
description: Returns a Program JSON Object containing the program, name and id.

unknown.tagValue: {Program Object} Returns a JSON object with Program data.

params.name: programKey
params.description: Name of the program.

return.description: Returns a JSON object with Program data.

name: addProgram
description:
Creates a Program JSON Object and initializes the program and metadata.
The program is added to the programs array.

params.name: programName
params.description: Name of the program.

params.name: vertexShaderSource
params.description: Source code of the vertex shader.

params.name: fragmentShaderSource
params.description: Source code of the fragment shader.

name: _createShadersProgram
description: Creates a WebGL program from a compiled vertex and fragment shader. The program is returned.

unknown.tagValue: {Program} A WebGL program. Null if unsuccessful.

params.name: vertexShader
params.description: A compiled vertex shader.

params.name: fragmentShader
params.description: A compiled fragment shader.

return.description: A WebGL program. Null if unsuccessful.

name: _createShader
description: Creates a shader of either Vertex or Fragment type and returns the compiled version.

unknown.tagValue: {CompiledShader} A compiled shader. Null if unsuccessful.

params.name: type
params.description: A GL shader type of either VERTEX_SHADER or FRAGMENT_SHADER.

params.name: source
params.description: Source code for the shader type.

return.description: A compiled shader. Null if unsuccessful.

name: _createProgram
description: Compiles the vertex shader and fragment shader and returns a WebGL program.

unknown.tagValue: {Program} A program compiled from the two shader sources.

params.name: vertexShaderSource
params.description: Source code for a vertex shader.

params.name: fragmentShaderSource
params.description: Source code for a fragment shader.

return.description: A program compiled from the two shader sources.

name: src/manager/RenderManager.js
start
description: Initial setup on GL rendering.

name: _updateProgram
description:
Checks if the program for the next object to draw must be changed.
If it does, it will change WebGL programs.

params.name: program
params.description: A program object returned from ProgramManager.getProgram()

name: update
description: Update function for updating all renderable objects in each viewport in the current scene.

name: src/manager/SceneManager.js
_SceneManager
description:
A manager which manages all scenes and passes commands to the current scene.

Manages scenes on a stack, pausing scenes below them (stopping rendering), and managing
the top scene for triggering updates on all objects on the scene.

GameObjects, components, or anything else can use the SceneManager to reference the
current active scene. There are also wrapper functions for passing SceneObjects and
Viewports to the current scene for registration with that scene.

name: registerSceneObject
description:
Adds a SceneObject to the current scene on the stack. The scene will hold 
reference and manage the SceneObject.

params.name: sceneObject
params.description: The SceneObject that is being registered.

name: registerViewport
description:
Addsa viewport to the current scene on the stack. The scene will hold reference
to the viewport.

params.name: viewport
params.description: The Viewport that is being registered.

name: getCurrentScene
description:
Gets the current scene on the stack. This scene will be the one currently
used in the update loop.

name: start
description: Starts the current scene on the stack.

name: update
description:
Updates the current scene and all SceneObjects that are assigned to that
scene.

name: end
description: Ends all scenes, starting from the top & poping each scene off the stack as it goes.

name: pause
description: Pauses the current scene.

name: unpause
description: Unpauses the current scene.

name: addScene
description:
Adds the new scene to the top of the stack, pausing the current
scene first.

params.name: scene
params.description: The new scene.

name: removeScene
description:
Removes the top scene from the stack, calls its end() function,
and unpauses the scene below it.

name: src/manager/UpdateableManager.js
_UpdateableManager
description:
Singleton manager that manages all Updateable Objects. All updateable objects are given a global game
ID (number) which can be used to distinguish it.

Any object that descends from Updateable will have an ID.

name: constructor
description: Constructor for UpdateableManager. Holds the static ID counter.

name: registerUpdateable
description:
Gives an ID and a way to unsubscribe from the Updateable binding with the manager.

Since the UpdateableManager does nothing to bind the Updateable to the manager, there is no code in the callback
assigned. However, the pattern is there to outline a default.

params.name: updateable
params.description: The updateable to be registered.

name: src/object/GameObject.js
GameObject
description:
Baseclass GameObject which derives from Updateable.

Do not derive this class directly! GameObjects are not managed until they are assigned to a manager.
Instead, derive SceneObject or PersistentObject to create objects that exist the scope of a scene, or the scope of the game.

All objects that should exist in the game screen should derive this.

name: constructor
description: Default position, size and rotation of the Object.

params.name: position
params.description: A point of creation in the world.

params.name: size
params.description: A point representing scale of the object.

params.name: rotation
params.description: A number representing angular rotation (in degrees).

name: addComponent
description:
Adds a component to this game object, and keeps reference to it.
GameObjects will handle their components as they are added to the object.

params.name: component
params.description: The component assigned to this object.

name: removeComponent
description: Removes a single component from this GameObject by ID.

params.name: componentID
params.description: Id of the component to remove.

name: removeComponents
description: Removes all Components of the named type.

params.name: componentName
params.description: The name of the components to clear.

name: removeAllComponents
description: Removes all components except for the Transform component.

name: hasComponent
description: Returns a boolean on if there is a component of type {componentName}.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} true if there is at least one component of this type.

params.name: componentName
params.description: Name of the component type to search for.

return.description: true if there is at least one component of this type.

name: getComponent
description:
Returns a component of type {componentName}. The second parameter can determine which 
Component of that type to return if there are more than 1.

params.name: componentName
params.description: Name of the component type to return.

params.name: index
params.description: Index of the component to get. Defaults to first component.

name: updateComponents
description: Updates all components on this GameObject.

name: postStartUpdate
description:
Rewritten postStartUpdate() functions which is originally defined in Updateable.
The GameObject adds a pre and post update function, and respective overrideable callbacks
(onPreUpdate and onPostUpdate).

name: preUpdate
description:
Called by the GameObject before an update to do default calls for preUpdating. Afterwards it
calls the overrideable function, onPreUpdate.

name: postUpdate
description:
Called by the GameObject after an update to do default calls for postUpdating. Afterwards it
calls the overrideable function, onPostUpdate.

name: onPreUpdate
description: Override for Pre Update functionality.

name: onPostUpdate
description: Override for Post Update functionality.

name: src/object/PersistentObject.js
PersistentObject
description:
A GameObject which exists across scenes. 

Objects which derive PersistentObjects do not belong to any one scene. 
If the derived object is intended to be rendered cross scene, the renderable component's
viewports must be reassigned on scene changes.

name: constructor
description: Default position, size and rotation of the Object.

params.name: position
params.description: A point of creation in the world.

params.name: size
params.description: A point representing scale of the object.

params.name: rotation
params.description: A number representing angular rotation (in degrees).

name: src/object/SceneObject.js
SceneObject
description:
A GameObject which exists only on the current active scene.
When this object is instantiated, it registers with the current active scene
through the SceneManager.

name: constructor
description: Default position, size and rotation of the Object.

params.name: position
params.description: A point of creation in the world.

params.name: size
params.description: A point representing scale of the object.

params.name: rotation
params.description: A number representing angular rotation (in degrees).

name: src/render/Viewport.js
Viewport
description:
A viewport is a display port on the game canvas. Each scene can have multiple
viewports and renderable objects are assigned to the ones they want to be drawn on.

Viewports contain lighting and cameras.

GameObjects and their components exist across all viewports, it is up to the programmer
to specify the viewports to render to.

Examples on when to use viewports: 
- UI
- Minimaps
- Different views

TODO: An object of keys represented by 'z' indexes to store all 
renderable objects in render order.

name: registerRenderableComponent
description: Register an Updateable component with this viewport for drawing.

params.name: renderable
params.description: Renderable component to register.

name: src/render/WebGL/Matrix.js
Matrix
description: Baseclass for a Matrix. Use Matrix3 or Matrix4 for 2D and 3D matrix math.

name: src/render/WebGL/Matrix3.js
setPosition
description:
Sets the translation positions of the matrix with x, y points. This overwrites the values and 
does not adjust the parameters to work relative to the rest of the matrix values.

params.name: x
params.description: X position.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position.

name: setScale
description:
Sets the scale values of the matrix with w, h values. This overwrites the values and 
does not adjust the parameters to work relative to the rest of the matrix values.

params.name: x
params.description: X scale.

params.name: y
params.description: Y scale.

name: setRotation
description:
Sets the matrix rotation values to rotate an object around the z axis. This overwrites the values and 
does not adjust the parameters to work relative to the rest of the matrix values.

name: copy
description:
Makes a copy of the matrix3. This is a static function and can be called
from Matrix3 prototype.

params.name: matrix
params.description: The matrix3 to copy.

name: add
description: Adds a matrix to this matrix.

params.name: m3
params.description: The matrix to add to this matrix.

name: projection
description:
Static function which returns a projection matrix converting the
top left coordinates to 0, 0, and bottom right to w, h.

(Converted from -1, -1 top left to 1, 1 bottom right.)

params.name: w
params.description: Width of the projection.

params.name: h
params.description: Height of the projection.

name: multiply
description: Multiplies a matrix into this matrix.

params.name: m3
params.description: The matrix to multiply to this matrix.

name: src/scene/BasicScene.js
BasicScene
description:
A basic representation of a working scene. Scenes need a viewport to give Renderable
components a place to be viewed by the RenderManager.

This scene only contains one viewport which takes up the size of the canvas element.

name: src/scene/Scene.js
Scene
description:
Baseclass for all scenes. When creating a new scene, it should inherit this
class. 
Scenes keep track of their scene objects and viewports. The scene baseclass has
functions for registering these with the scene.

name: constructor
description: Builds the SceneObjects and Viewports list.

name: registerSceneObject
description:
When a SceneObject is created, it is routed through the SceneManager to the current
active scene to this function. The SceneObject will register with the scene to be referenced
on update/pause/destruct calls on a scene specific basis.

params.name: sceneObject
params.description: A SceneObject to register.

name: registerRenderableComponent
description: Registers a Renderable component with the viewport, by index.

params.name: renderable
params.description: A Renderable to register to the viewport.

params.name: viewportIndex
params.description: The index of the viewport.

name: registerViewport
description:
When a Viewport is created, it is routed through the SceneManager to the current
active scene to this function. The Viewport will register with the scene to be referenced
by the RenderManager and assigned to by Renderables.

params.name: viewport
params.description: A Viewport to register.

name: src/utils/GlobalMessager.js
src/utils/MathUtil.js
degToRad
description: Converts degrees to radians.

params.name: deg
params.description: A number in degrees.

name: radToDeg
description: Converts radians to degress.

params.name: rad
params.description: A number in radians.

name: src/utils/Messager.js

content:
# Seed Engine

### Welcome
Seed Engine is a lightweight 2D game engine using WebGL2. The engine is designed on the focus of creating a bridge between creating and publishing games to the Seed Network as modules.

### Installation
The easiest way to get started with Seed Engine is by using NPM:
```
npm i seed-engine --save
```

Now you can reference the Engine like so:
```
import {Engine} from 'seed-engine';
```

Each file is its own class, similar to react. Multiple imports may look something like:
```
import {Engine, SceneObject, Transform, Renderable2D} from 'seed-engine';
```

### Documentation
You can view the docs [here](https://jaegarsarauer.github.io/SeedGameEngine/index.html).


### Testing
You can run tests using the npm command:
```
npm run test
```

Testing documentation can be found [here](https://jaegarsarauer.github.io/SeedGameEngine/test.html).


### Notes
 - The engine updates all systems on a parent first, children after pattern.
    - However, GameObjects have two functions added to their Updateable _update() for calling pre and post updates. These updates happen before and after a regular update on the parent.
name: ./README.md
package.json
test/helper/Test.js
test/tests/ExampleTest.js
